DataElement.preferredDefinition: A numeric code to identify the Gadolinium-based agent used for MR imaging.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of Gadolinium used in a type of image which uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Property.preferredDefinition: An element with atomic symbol Gd, atomic number 64, and atomic weight 157.25.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Gd, atomic number 64, and atomic weight 157.25.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/24/13 Corrected typo in definition.12/3/12 jc Old caBIG ACRIN content moved to ACRIN context; Imaging Modality -> MRI.  1/13/09 Released to support C3D Adopter reuse request.  3/13/08 created for ACRIN Breast DCE/MRI 6676-M3 & 6676-M4.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of numbered categories to indicate the form of Gadolinium used in the image.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: ProHance (Gadoteridol Injection) is a nonionic contrast medium for magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), available as a 0.5M sterile clear colorless to slightly yellow aqueous solution in vials and syringes for intravenous injection.

OMNISCAN (gadodiamide) Injection is the formulation of the gadolinium complex of diethylenetriamine pentaacetic acid bismethylamide, and is an injectable, nonionic extracellular enhancing agent for magnetic resonance imaging.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An element with atomic symbol Gd, atomic number 64, and atomic weight 157.25.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Gd, atomic number 64, and atomic weight 157.25.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
